A lot of twists and deaths. I feel like: If I hadn't paid so much money to see this disgrace of a \"Star Wars\" film - if you can even call it that - I would have got up and left like several others in the audience after Carrie Fisher flew through outer space like Peter Pan. This movie tried too hard to be funny as well with corny lines and pointless interactions. Not to mention\, the main villain Snoke was less developed as a character than a minor side character. If you go to see this movie\, enjoy your pandering\, Disney-fied husk of the universe that George Lucas worked so hard to develop. Episode I was actually better. Your jaw will drop for sure\, but in disgust rather than awe.
